posts.content:
It was the hottest and driest summer in 25 years and a good opportunity for the first wild camping and fishing trip with little Sybil.

As Tom, Dan, Sybil and I set off from Hartsop, the heavans opened and big fat rain drops started to fall from the sky like fat wet frogs.

We'd never been up to Angle Tarn before.
We'd fished Hayes Water a number of times but never Angle Tarn. Where the path splits, we took the left fork and headed up past the Filter House in Hayeswater Gill.
